Dave worked at eInstruction by Turning Technologies

As VP of Engineering at WellMatch, I oversaw the growth of a successful healthcare price transparency application, from an engineering team of 6 to over 40 engineers. Among the many challenging tasks this team accomplished, we initiated and completed a significant application rearchitecture project, while maintaining the highest level of collaboration and team morale I'd ever worked with.

As Team Lead of the Finance pod, I was responsible for an engineering group that managed all of LivingSocial's internal financial applications. Our group's codebases interacted with multiple internal and external services, calculating and distributing virtually all of the company's day-to-day liabilities and payouts for merchants as well as sales commissions.
I worked as senior developer on LivingSocial's mobile applications team, working mainly in Ruby on Rails and Android.

Dave was a terrific partner in pushing the Android app forward and improving LivingSocial's mobile presence. From a strictly technical perspective Dave was great, able to move between the Java code, Rails code, to hunting down bugs in various APIs, and always taking the time to develop in a way that produced clean code and didn't create more problems later. He also had a great eye for the business goals and we were always able to easily agree on roadmaps and which priorities would really impact the important metrics. His responsiveness despite our geographic distance as well as his commitment to scrum tracking made working with him very easy. Hope to have the opportunity to do so again!

July 30, 2012, Mike worked with Dave in the same group

Mike has an innate feel for Product Management. He has great business instincts for the small details that can make or break a new application feature, and a real gift for communicating and translating his ideas into effective project requirements.  While working with Mike on the reboot of LivingSocial's Android mobile application, Mike created and prioritized work effectively and quickly, kept the backlog in near pristine condition, integrated new features, analytics and infrastructure initiatives into the project pipeline in such an effective and consistent manner that the developers working with him were better able to deliver the most important business value much quicker.  One thing that impressed me about Mike was his commitment to measuring every initiative. He didn't just come up with new ideas for the application, he always worked with the developers on plans to gather realistic analytic data, to better assess new features' effectiveness. His work ethic, smarts, and attention to detail made him invaluable to the team's efforts.
